author: 0xflamingo
content: Hello everyone, is this page always open? Until feedback is contributed.

author: jsign
content:
If anyone is planning to participate ~~ in the second phase~~  with "special contributions" in the KZG ceremony, you might want to take a look at a tentative PR that supports offline contributions in the Go client I’m maintaining.
https://github.com/jsign/go-kzg-ceremony-client/pull/10

You can read the PR description but quick TL;DR:
- Allows to separate the contribution into three sub-commands: `download-state`, `contribute`, and `send-contribution`. This allows you to make the contribution step offline and save it to a file to send later.
- New `--hex-entropy` flag to provide randomness directly via CLI. (The flag to pull randomness from a URL could still be useful but can be inconvenient in air-gapped devices).
- New `--sequencer-url` flag if you want to target a testing environment.

Thanks to many ~~phase2~~ "special contributions" projects that are testing this version and recommending features. Feel free to send me a DM if you're testing this or have comments.

You can read the PR description but quick TL;DR:
- Allows to separate the contribution into three sub-commands: `download-state`, `contribute`, and `send-contribution`. This allows you to make the contribution step offline and save it to a file to send later.
- New `--hex-entropy` flag to provide randomness directly via CLI. (The flag to pull randomness from a URL could still be useful but can be inconvenient in air-gapped devices).
- New `--sequencer-url` flag if you want to target a testing environment.

Thanks to many phase2 projects that are testing this version and recommending features. Feel free to send me a DM if you're testing this or have comments.)

author: jsign
content: Good call, I refer to "special contributions". I'll edit to avoid confusion!

author: piersog
content: Hi! I've been stuck here for a week now, the wheel is still rolling but i don't know if I should wait still. I've been trying to participate since mid february but never made it. Am I doing something wrong? I authorize with my wallet and sign, but I end up there for days. Thanks for the help!

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> So the browser is waiting for a response from your wallet. Hard refreshing this page should solve it. Otherwise, take a look to see if your mobile/hw wallet etc is connected and waiting for a you to sign. Finally if all the above doesn't work, try a different browser.
